comments: I absolutely loved this class and I would take it over again no doubt. She makes the subject so interesting and easy to understand. It is a difficult class no doubt but she gives you the tools to succeed. Study hard, you have to work to earn your grade. She gives extra credit (bingo & study guides) but class is not curved. Best professor ever!

comments: Stay on top of your studies and you\'ll get an A. Don\'t be late or miss class, you\'ll lose a point each time. 5 tests and an easy final project. Lowest test score replaced with test average. Quizzes every Tuesday based on previous and upcoming lab, labs are due every Thursday. More E.C. opportunities arise as the semester continues. Very sweet prof!

comments: Professor Von Der Ohe is great! She provides you with everything you need in order to get an A in the class. Watch the lectures before you go to class so you will know what she\'s talking about. There\'s no shortcut around this class. You need to be focused, study, and know the material in order to get good grades. She\'s the best!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

comments: Professor Von Der Ohe is a very organized and clear on her assignments. Her class consists of 5 Exams - short answer, multiple choice, fill in the blank and short answer. There is a quiz every week based on the lab. And she also gives 3 group writing assignments. You need to study in order to get an A in the class. She offers extra credit

comments: Awesome Professor! Dr. von truly cares about her students and is extremely kind and approachable. She makes Physiology very straightforward and fun! The exams are not too difficult, if you put in the work. And labs are really fun too! Highly recommend her. Also, she offers tons of extra credit!

comments: I\'m a UCLA alum & Prof. von der Ohe is definitely one of the best professors I\'ve ever had! She\'s amazing at teaching! Physiology itself is difficult, but Prof. von der Ohe is very approachable & integrates clinical cases/notes to further prepare those pursuing health care. Exams are short answer heavy, but appropriately reflect course content.

comments: Awesome professor. She gives you every possible resource to learn the material. All lectures and powerpoint are online. Heavy on short answers in exams. Difficult grader on short answers but not impossible. Make sure to learn the material from all angles and ask questions. She is very approachable and visit her during office hours.

comments: Scholars Program. 3 group reading analysis papers. 1 quiz a week about previous lab (with a few questions about future lab). 5 tests all from the her powerpoints. Extra credit bingo. Really great personality, respectable, and helpful. No final test, just a final group project. Book not necessary unless you really want to get into detail.

comments: This is an intense course you need to dedicate a lot of time in order to pass. 6% extra credit, 3 exams 60% short answers, 40% multiple choice, labs are fun, but easy to lose points. 1 group presentation on a body system, class is not curved, 2 formal lab reports, Professor von is very approachable and her lectures are on youtube, I will miss her.

Super helpful towards her students and cares a lot. very approachable. make sure to listen to audio lectures online before the class or you wont understand anything. lets you record her lectures. it helps to listen back to the recordings and write everything down. tough tests, tough grader. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

comments: I found her to be a very fair Professor. There is a quiz every week on the previous and upcoming labs. Exams are about every 3 weeks. I learned so much in this class. However, I was very disciplined and study very hard to earn my A. If you want an A you can\'t expect to receive it without earning it. I love the subject so much that I am now an SI.

comments: This is one of the hardest class I ever took! All the exam comes from her power point lecture. I recommend you record her lecture and memorize the PowerPoint lecture. 60% of the exam are essay questions and 40% is multiple choice! You need to study every day for this class! You got to put the effort and the time if you want to pass with A or B!

comments: This is a very tough class. Exams are too long and it\'s not enough time to complete the exam. Most of the questions are easy questions and 40% is multiple choice. Take advantage of the Extra credit. She will ask one question based on the subject that will be covered for the day or from previous lecture! Get good grades on the Lab! Good luck!

comments: Good lectures, lots of material, like ppts and videos that help with studying and understanding the material. Helps if you ask but does the minimum. Tests way too hard, questions have grammatical errors, multiple choice with multiple correct answers, etc. Don\'t question a grade, she\'s on a power trip with the grading and never wrong.

comments: This has to be one of the best professors I have ever had! She helps you with any questions you have, her lectures are very enjoyable, and made the semester a delight. Physiology isn\'t an easy course, so that says a lot. I would definitely recommend Dr. Von Der Ohe to everyone at SMC! :D

comments: She\'s one of few teachers thats crystal clear when lecturing, nice, approachable and responds to emails. Attendance is mandatory for an A or B. Labs and quizzes every week and 5 non-cumulative exams but they\'re really straight-forward with no tricks. She is a very fair grader and really wants you to learn the concepts.

comments: Amazing professor! Really passionate not only about the subject but also about teaching students the material. Very kind and understanding yet challenging. It\'s not a difficult class if you put in 100% effort otherwise you looking at maybe a passing grade. She is very clear and easy to follow on lectures and she made the labs even more fun.
